alert.note: Alert for Pike; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 10:05PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM EDT... At 1005 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Pike Lake, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Waverly, Piketon, Pike Lake, Londonderry, Beaver, Pike County Airport, Elm Grove, Omega, Buchanan, Givens, Summithill, Richmond Dale, Linn, Lake White, Scioto Trail State Park and Idaho. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
